Elderflower and Lemon Curd Celebration C.title: Elderflower and Lemon Curd Celebration Cake
Elderflower and Lemon Curd Celebration C.description: Having a celebration? Delight your guests with this fresh tasting Elderflower and Lemon Curd cake.

Decoration.0: Pesticide free flowers of choice for decoration

directions.0: Preheat oven to 180°C, 160°C fan, Gas mark 4. Grease and bottom line 2 2 x 20cm round cake tins with baking paper.
directions.1: Beat the Flora Buttery and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then fold in the lemon zest and flour. Divide evenly between the two cake tins and level the surface.
directions.2: Bake for 30 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean. Leave to cool for 5 minutes then turn out to cool on a cooling rack.
directions.3: To make the icing beat the Flora Buttery and icing sugar together with 2 tablespoons of elderflower cordial and 2 tablespoons of lemon juice until light and creamy. To make the drizzle simply blend 2 tablespoons elderflower cordial with 2 tablespoons lemon juice (or more if you like a sharper lemon flavour).
directions.4: To assemble, slice each of the sponges horizontally and place the first sponge on a serving plate. Sprinkle a little drizzle over the base, then spread lemon curd over and top with the 2nd sponge. Sprinkle drizzle over and spread a layer of icing. Top with the 3rd sponge, sprinkle with drizzle and spread with lemon curd. Top with the remaining sponge and spread icing all over the cake to coat.
directions.5: Pipe a ring of pearls around the base of the cake, decorate with fresh flowers and serve.

Chocolate Brownies.title: Chocolate Brownies
Chocolate Brownies.description: No-one can resist a rich, gooey chocolate brownie. This easy recipe includes cocoa powder, dark chocolate, vanilla, set natural yogurt and Flora Cuisine – all speckled with crunchy flaked almonds. Just mix them all up, pour into a pan and bake. Simple. With very little effort you’ll be cutting up warm chocolate brownies ready to hand out – but be warned, they’ll all be gone just as quickly and easily!

directions.0: Break the chocolate into a bowl and melt over a pan of hot water (or in a microwave on medium power). Add the Flora Cuisine.
directions.1: In a large bowl, whisk the eggs with the sugar and vanilla until creamy and slightly thickened.
directions.2: Sieve the dry ingredients and add to the eggs with the chocolate mixture, yogurt and nuts. Mix gently.
directions.3: Pour into a greased 22cm (9 inch) square tin.
directions.4: Bake in a preheated oven at 160°C, 150°C fan, gas mark 3 for 45–55 minutes.
directions.5: Leave to cool before cutting into squares.

American Pancakes.title: American Pancakes
American Pancakes.description: These American pancakes are thick, fluffy and ready to stack high on a plate, just like in the movies! The difference from regular pancakes is that these bubble and rise a little in the pan – but they are still wonderfully simple to make. Serve them with Flora Buttery, syrup and fruit (or even crisp bacon for a special treat) for a deliciously easy breakfast recipe.

directions.0: In a medium mixing bowl sift all of the dry ingredients together. Make a well in the middle and set aside.
directions.1: In a separate bowl or jug, combine the wet ingredients and whisk together until well combined.
directions.2: Add the wet mix to the dry mix and stir until just moistened. The mixture will be lumpy but that’s fine.
directions.3: Heat a frying pan and add a little Flora Cuisine. Once it's hot, drop ladles of the mix onto the pan. Once they are bubbly on the top and the edges appear dry (after about 2 minutes), it’s time to turn them.
directions.4: Cook for a further 2 mins. Serve immediately with a dollop of Flora Buttery and maple or golden syrup.
